title: France-Israel: The gray zones around defense cooperation
summary: Since the start of the war in Gaza, Paris has walked a thin line, reducing arms exports to Israel without completely severing military ties.

title: Hamas says it will not accept truce that does not end Gaza war
summary: A senior Hamas official also accused Benjamin Netanyahu of 'personally hindering' a deal due to 'personal interests.' Qatari, Egyptian, and US mediators met a Hamas delegation in Cairo on Saturday in the latest bid to halt the war.

title: Chad, the 'last Western domino' in the Sahel – for how long?
summary: Chad, France's unfailing partner in the Sahel region, is preparing for a tense presidential election on Monday. Paris, which claims to be reducing its military footprint in Africa, wants to go beyond security cooperation.

title: Mona Lisa: Painting should be separated 'to save other works polluted by overtourism'
summary: The museum's management wants to isolate the 'Mona Lisa' in a room with its own entrance, which could help rid the painting of overtourism, says Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde.

title: London Mayor Sadiq Khan wins record third term for Labour as Tories routed in local polls
summary: London Mayor Sadiq Khan becomes the first leader to secure a record three terms since the post was created in 2000.

title: A drug trafficker comes clean: 'I know I'm dead, they're going to put contracts all over my head'
summary: For two years, Kamel worked for one of France's biggest drug traffickers, Abdelkader Bouguettaia, alias 'Bibi.' Arrested after a container was searched in the port of Le Havre, he has provided investigators with an avalanche of information.

title: Frank Stella, leading American artist, dies at 87
summary: Frank Stella, an American painter who became a dominant figure in postwar American art, notably with early minimalist works, died on Saturday, May 4.

title: Student protests against Israel's offensive in Gaza spread
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday condemned the university blockades at Sciences Po and other French universities that 'prevented debate.'

title: Macron urged to put human rights at heart of talks with China's Xi ahead of visit
summary: Multiple French politicians and human rights organizations have criticized Beijing's repression of Uyghurs and Tibetans ahead of the Chinese president's visit to France on May 6 and 7.

title: Volodymyr Zelensky put on Russia's wanted list
summary: In an online statement published that same day, Ukraine's foreign ministry dismissed the reports of the Ukrainian president's inclusion as evidence of 'the desperation of the Russian state machine and propaganda.'

title: Over 6,000 German army meetings, some classified, accessible to anyone online
summary: Federal prosecutors are already investigating a secret army conversation on the Ukraine war that was wiretapped and ended up on Russian social media in March.

title: Floods in southern Brazil: 57 dead, 70,000 evacuated
summary: Two people also died in an explosion at a flooded gas station in Porto Alegre. 74 people are injured and another 67 are missing, civil defense said.

title: Palestinian doctor Ghassan Abu-Sittah denied entry into France
summary: Doctor Abu-Sittah, who worked for a month and a half in the Palestinian enclave at the start of the war, was turned away on arrival at Paris' Charles-de-Gaulle airport on Saturday.

title: Russia, an embarrassing source of profit for major international banks
summary: Foreign banks still present in the country have paid some €900 million in income tax for 2023, according to the Kyiv School of Economics.

title: France probes TotalEnergies over 2021 Mozambique attack
summary: French prosecutors said on Saturday that they were investigating oil giant TotalEnergies for possible involuntary manslaughter in connection with a 2021 jihadist attack in Mozambique.

title: Dublin campus barricaded in pro-Palestinian student protest
summary: Security staff closed the gates to Trinity College Dublin's campus, usually open to the public, 'to ensure safety,' the university said in a statement.

title: EU-Lebanon deal aims to prevent Syrian refugees from reaching Cyprus
summary: The European Union plans to allocate €1 billion in aid to Beirut in exchange for cooperation from the Lebanese authorities in curbing illegal immigration to Europe.

title: US blames Rwanda for deadly attack on displaced camp in DR Congo
summary: A bomb at a refugee camp in eastern Congo killed at least nine people, including children, on Friday.

title: Togo ruling party wins legislative vote
summary: The result, announced Saturday by the electoral commission, comes after a divisive constitutional reform critics say allows President Faure Gnassingbé to extend his time in power.

title: Russell 'Texas' Bentley: The life and death of an American from Donetsk
summary: Based in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region since 2014, 'Texas' committed himself body and soul to the pro-Russian side. He was likely killed by Russian soldiers who mistook him for a spy.

title: Joe Biden in search of an elusive peace on US campuses and in Gaza
summary: Denounced by progressive youth for his policy of support for Israel and accused by the Republican right of allowing chaos in universities to flourish, the US president faces a delicate political situation.

title: Macron's meeting with Xi: Talking to China, without illusions
summary: Faced with the world's second-largest power, France has no interest in going it alone and pandering to its Chinese counterpart. Only a united Europe has any chance of being heard by Beijing.

title: At the Fondation Louis Vuitton in Paris, Matisse, Kelly, and the irresistible power of color
summary: Two exhibitions, held until September 9, illustrate the two painters' shared taste for chromatic intensity.

title: In Brazil, Madonna gives a giant free concert on Copacabana beach
summary: An estimated 1.5 million people attended the last show of The Celebration Tour on Saturday, which kicked off in October 2023 in London.

title: Dua Lipa, from the beach bar to the dance floor
summary: 'Radical Optimism,' the British-Albanian singer's third album, proves to be more timid than its title. Unlike Taylor Swift, who turned to folk for a while, or Beyoncé, with her recent country urges, Dua Lipa isn't leaving her comfort zone.

title: Auroville, India's utopian town threatened by disenchantment and Hindu nationalism
summary: The Indian town designed by French architect Mirra Alfassa and steadily built since 1968 is the only surviving project of its kind. But its future is in jeopardy because of internal dissension and attacks from Narendra Modi's government.
